methods_proposed.name: Naive Forecast
methods_proposed.description: Uses previous year's quantity as prediction

methods_proposed.name: Linear Regression
methods_proposed.description: Linear regression using lag and rolling mean features
methods_proposed.implementation_code:
def predict_linear_regression(train_df, test_df, target_col, date_col=None, feature_cols=['lag_2022_23', 'rolling_mean_2y'], **params):
    import pandas as pd
    from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
    
    X_train = train_df[feature_cols].fillna(0)
    y_train = train_df[target_col]
    X_test = test_df[feature_cols].fillna(0)
    
    model = LinearRegression()
    model.fit(X_train, y_train)
    predictions = model.predict(X_test)
    return pd.DataFrame({'predicted': predictions}, index=test_df.index)

methods_proposed.name: Random Forest
methods_proposed.description: Random forest using multiple engineered features
methods_proposed.implementation_code:
def predict_random_forest(train_df, test_df, target_col, date_col=None, feature_cols=['lag_2022_23', 'rolling_mean_2y', 'Production-2024-25'], **params):
    import pandas as pd
    from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
    
    X_train = train_df[feature_cols].fillna(0)
    y_train = train_df[target_col]
    X_test = test_df[feature_cols].fillna(0)
    
    model = RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
    model.fit(X_train, y_train)
    predictions = model.predict(X_test)
    return pd.DataFrame({'predicted': predictions}, index=test_df.index)
